forge.gui
Class MultiLineLabelUI

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.plaf.ComponentUI
      javax.swing.plaf.LabelUI
          javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicLabelUI
              forge.gui.MultiLineLabelUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentListener, PropertyChangeListener, EventListener
public class MultiLineLabelUI
extends BasicLabelUI
implements ComponentListener

Label UI delegate that supports multiple lines and line wrapping. Hard line breaks (\n) are preserved. If the dimensions of the label is too small to fit all content, the string will be clipped and "..." appended to the end of the visible text (similar to the default behavior of JLabel). If used in conjunction with a MultiLineLabel, text alignment (horizontal and vertical) is supported. The UI delegate can be used on a regular JLabel if text alignment isn't required. The default alignment, left and vertically centered, will then be used.

Example of usage: 

 JLabel myLabel = new JLabel();
 myLabel.setUI(MultiLineLabelUI.labelUI);
 myLabel.setText("A long label that will wrap automatically.");

The line and wrapping support is implemented without using a View to make it easy for subclasses to add custom text effects by overriding BasicLabelUI.paintEnabledText(JLabel, Graphics, String, int, int) and BasicLabelUI.paintDisabledText(JLabel, Graphics, String, int, int). This class is designed to be easily extended by subclasses.

Version:
1.3.0
Author:
Samuel Sjoberg, http://samuelsjoberg.com

prepareLines

protected List<String> prepareLines(JLabel l)
Prepare the text lines for rendering. The lines are wrapped to fit in the current available space for text. Explicit line breaks are preserved.

Parameters:
l - the label to render
Returns:
a list of text lines to render

calculateBreakPosition

protected int calculateBreakPosition(Document doc,
                                     int p0,
                                     int p1)
Calculate the position on which to break (wrap) the line.

Parameters:
doc - the document
p0 - start position
p1 - end position
Returns:
the actual end position, will be p1 if content does not need to wrap, otherwise it will be less than p1.
